resources.string: \tThis calculator outputs the solution(s) given a system of linear equations. Input a minimum of two equations, then press Solve to see the solution if it exists. If the system has more than one solution, only the first solution found will be displayed.

\tThis calculator will reduce a matrix into reduced echelon form. Input the number of rows and columns of the matrix, input the matrix elements, and then press Calculate to get the matrix in reduced echelon form. \n\tWhen inputting matrix elements for a row, separate each element by a single space. When inputting elements for another row, use a new line.

\tThis calculator will find the inverse of the an input square matrix, if it exists. Input the matrix size, fill in the matrix elements, and then press Calculate to see the result. Separate each element by a single space when inputting elements. When inputting elements for another row, use a new line.

This calculator will find the determinant of the an input matrix. Input the number of rows and columns of the matrix, fill in the matrix elements, and then press Calculate to see the result. Separate each element by a single space when inputting elements. When inputting elements for another row, use a new line.

This calculator will find the list of vectors that span the null space of the input matrix. Input the number of rows and columns of the matrix, input the matrix elements, and then press Calculate to get the matrix in reduced echelon form. When inputting matrix elements for a row, separate each element by a single space. When inputting elements for another row, use a new line.

Welcome to 'Math: Calculators for Everyone'! Our goal is to allow you to have access to more than one calculator to fit all of your needs. 
 	We offer to you a Basic Calculator, with which you can use for most basic math equations, such as add, subtract, multiply and divide. 
 	Our Inverse Matrix Calculator quickly calculates the inverse of your provided matrix with ease. 
 	We have our Echelon Calculator which reduces a matrix into reduced echelon form in no time! 
 	Our next calculator is our System of Linear Systems calculator, that can solve System of Linear Equation Problems. If you need help finding x and y, we have your back! 
 	Next we have our Determinant Calculator. Another calculator that works with matrices, this calculator will reduce to echelon form and multiply the matrix by itself. All you need to do is provide the values! 
 	Finally, we have our Null Space Calculator, which will compute the null space of your provided matrix. 
 
Happy Calculating!
Are you interested in learning more about how some of these calculators work? Check out the links down below!
Welcome to Math: Calculators for Everyone
Enter each equation on a separate line:
Select any calculator you want to use from the list below.
No input value for matrix size
ERROR: Matrix size is limited to a maximum of 10 rows and 10 columns
SYNTAX ERROR: Matrix can not have zero rows or zero columns
Matrix does not have an inverse
EVALUATION ERROR: Check if input is valid, then try again.
System does not have a solution
EVALUATION ERROR: Check if input is valid, then try again.
SYNTAX ERROR: Matrix can not have zero rows or zero columns
ERROR: Matrix size is limited to a maximum of 10 rows and 10 columns
